summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Parks, Trails, and the Environment Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on April 1, 2024, at 9:00 AM in the Council Chambers on the 6th floor of City Hall. The meeting will be accessible both in-person and via video conference, with live broadcasts available on Spectrum Cable and online.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The meeting will include the approval of the minutes from the March 4, 2024, meeting and several briefing items. Key topics for discussion include an overview of the Municipal Setting Designation and Environmental Due Diligence Program, an annual update from the Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden, and initiatives related to the "Keep Dallas Beautiful" program.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include a memorandum of understanding on water conservation with the Tarrant Regional Water District and an update from the Environmental Commission. These items reflect ongoing efforts to enhance environmental quality and sustainability in Dallas.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval for the previous meeting's minutes and will review the aforementioned briefing items to inform future actions and policies. No specific decisions requiring a vote are indicated in the agenda, but discussions may lead to recommendations for future initiatives.
